summary: A detailed grievance complaint by an Epstein and Maxwell sex trafficking survivor against her former attorneys David Boies, Sigrid McCawley, Stanley Pottinger, and Brad Edwards. The document alleges ethical violations, conflicts of interest, coercion, failure to protect the client's safety, and betrayal of trust, including being pressured to give a deposition for another client, being misled about confidentiality, and being inadequately represented in her own civil case.

persons.name: David Boies
persons.context: Founding partner of Boies Schiller Flexner, accused of conflicts of interest, pressuring the victim, and having undisclosed personal ties to Bill Clinton.

persons.name: Sigrid McCawley
persons.context: Lawyer at Boies Schiller who communicated with the victim about depositions, settlement, and evidence, and is accused of failing to protect the victim's interests.

persons.name: Stanley Pottinger
persons.context: Lawyer at Boies Schiller (referred to as 'Stan') who coordinated with the victim regarding depositions, affidavits, and settlement, and is accused of gaslighting and pressuring her.

persons.name: Brad Edwards
persons.context: Lawyer who worked with the victim, authored the book 'Relentless Pursuit', and is accused of ghosting the victim and failing to protect her safety.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central perpetrator accused of sex trafficking and raping the victim and others; his death is mentioned.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Epstein's associate, accused of facilitating sex trafficking; her trial and sentencing are mentioned.

persons.name: Jean Luc Brunel
persons.context: Associated with Epstein, mentioned as giving photos to victims and running Karen Models.

persons.name: Igor Zinoviev
persons.context: Epstein's bodyguard who confirmed to Brad Edwards that the victim tried to swim off the island; his deposition was allegedly never taken.

persons.name: Sergey Brin
persons.context: Described as a long-time friend of Epstein and Maxwell, mentioned as being on the island with the victim.

persons.name: Ann Wojcicki
persons.context: Mentioned as Sergey Brin's then-fianc√© who was on the island with the victim.

persons.name: Alan Dershowitz
persons.context: Mentioned in the context of a case where the victim's deposition was sought to be unsealed, causing the victim fear.

persons.name: Bill Clinton
persons.context: Accused by the victim of being a co-conspirator of Epstein; his undisclosed friendship with David Boies is cited as a major conflict of interest.

persons.name: Hillary Clinton
persons.context: Mentioned in connection with Bill Clinton and as having received donations from Epstein; her 2016 presidential campaign prompted the victim to come forward.

persons.name: Harvey Weinstein
persons.context: Mentioned in connection with David Boies' representation and alleged silencing tactics, and a potential Epstein connection.

persons.name: Prince Andrew
persons.context: Mentioned as a focus of legal and media attention in Epstein-related cases, which the victim questions given other unprosecuted associates.

persons.name: Judge Richard M. Berman
persons.context: Presided over Epstein-related proceedings and allowed victims to give impact statements.

persons.name: James Marsh
persons.context: The victim's current attorney from Marsh Law Firm who helped file motions to protect her privacy.

persons.name: Robert Lewis
persons.context: Referred to as 'Bob', the victim's current attorney who helped file motions.

persons.name: Peter
persons.context: The victim's partner who traveled with her, communicated with her lawyers about her injuries, and supported her.

persons.name: Karyna Shuliak
persons.context: Described as Epstein's girlfriend, the last person to speak to him before his death, and married to a man from Belarus.

persons.name: Lisa Bloom
persons.context: Mentioned in connection with Harvey Weinstein and alleged silencing tactics, with denial of affiliation from Sigrid McCawley.

persons.name: Gloria Allred
persons.context: Mentioned for her media campaign against Prince Andrew, with denial of affiliation from Sigrid McCawley.

persons.name: Cathy Alexander
persons.context: Mentioned as the house manager on Epstein's island, appearing in a photo.

persons.name: Valdson
persons.context: Mentioned in a 2006 flight detail email as traveling with the victim to St. Thomas.

connections.description: Partners/attorneys at Boies Schiller Flexner who worked together on the victim's case and other Epstein-related litigation.
Alleged close personal friendship, evidenced by a December 2016 dinner, which the victim claims was a conflict of interest not disclosed to her.
Described as co-conspirators in a sex trafficking operation where Maxwell facilitated victims for Epstein.
Brunel provided photos to victims and ran a modeling agency allegedly used to traffic women for Epstein.
Edwards met with Epstein's bodyguard Igor, who confirmed the victim's attempt to swim off the island.
The victim was represented by Boies and his firm in her civil case against Epstein, a relationship she claims was abusive and conflicted.
The victim tried to reconnect with a fellow survivor she was on the island with, who was later represented by Boies Schiller.
Pottinger was one of the victim's primary points of contact, accused of gaslighting, pressuring her, and making demeaning comments.
Boies represented Weinstein and was photographed having dinner with him, which the victim sees as part of a pattern of representing abusers.

events.title: Victim's deposition for another client
events.description: The victim was pressured to give a deposition in support of another client of Boies Schiller in a case against Ghislaine Maxwell. She was promised it would remain confidential.

events.title: Filing of victim's civil claim
events.description: Boies Schiller filed the victim's civil claim against Epstein before formally signing a retainer agreement with her.

events.title: Settlement of victim's case
events.description: The victim's civil case against Epstein was settled. She claims she was pressured to accept while heavily medicated and recovering from a suicide attempt.

events.title: Victim's suicide attempt
events.description: The victim attempted suicide by jumping off a balcony, resulting in broken feet and a fractured back. She links this to the treatment by her lawyers and the stress of the case.

events.title: Motion to unseal victim's deposition
events.description: Boies Schiller asked the court to unseal the victim's 2017 deposition against her wishes, to benefit another client in a case against Alan Dershowitz.

events.title: Victim Impact Statements at Maxwell proceedings
events.description: Judge Richard Berman invited survivors to give Victim Impact Statements following Epstein's death.

events.title: Publication of New York Times Op-Ed
events.description: An op-ed titled 'How David Boies Saved Me' was published with the victim's name, which she claims she was pressured to agree to for Boies's reputation rehabilitation.

events.title: Flight to St. Thomas with Epstein associates
events.description: The victim traveled to St. Thomas with another girl and a man named Valdson, staying at an Epstein residence.

locations: St. Thomas Island, U.S. Virgin Islands
keyFacts: The victim alleges her lawyers at Boies Schiller Flexner coerced her into giving a deposition for another client's case before formally representing her, promising it would remain confidential, then later sought to unseal it.

She claims the firm failed to protect her safety, ignored her fears of being tracked by Epstein, and pressured her into a settlement while she was heavily medicated and recovering from a suicide attempt.

The document alleges a major conflict of interest: David Boies had an undisclosed personal friendship with Bill Clinton, whom the victim considers a co-conspirator of Epstein, and this was not disclosed when she cited Clinton as a reason for coming forward.

The victim states that key witnesses in her own case (like Igor Zinoviev and a recruiter) were never deposed, and her case was settled without crucial discovery, while the firm aggressively pursued other high-profile cases (e.g., involving Prince Andrew).

She accuses her attorneys of gaslighting, ghosting, disparaging her to journalists, and violating ethical rules by prioritizing other clients' interests over hers, causing severe emotional and financial harm.
